intro: Chondrilla sagittata, commonly known as the arrowhead chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in grasslands and open habitats. The plant features distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers during the summer months. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Chondrilla sagittata is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
